Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
black-tie \black-tie\ adj. requiring semiformal evening clothes, e. g. a black bowtie and a tuxedo or dinner jacket for men, and a formal dress for women; contrasted with {white-tie}, for a fully formal occasion, and with {informal}, and {casual}. a black-tie dinner
Syn: semi-formal, semiformal. [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]
black tie n 1: semiformal evening dress for men [syn: {dinner jacket}, {tux}, {tuxedo}] 2: a black bow tie worn with a dinner jacket
black-tie adj : moderately formal; requiring a dinner jacket; "he wore semiformal attire"; "a black-tie dinner" [syn: {semiformal}, {semi-formal}]
